var.eval: \ "wind-event" \ if item["id"] in workflow_types["wind-events"] \ else "earthquake-event" \ if item["id"] in workflow_types["earthquake-events"] \ else "qfem-event" \ if item["id"] in workflow_types["qfem-events"] \ else "-" \

Creates SAM.json file and generates script for creating a hysteretic multi-degree of freedom (MDOF) system subject to earthquake time history analysis, based on the Lu method. Analysis is executed by the OpenSeesSimulation application.
name of file containing the event data

Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSees structural model. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesSimulation application.
File containing a dictionary of building information.
File containing event intensity measure for each simulation per building.
Defines the location of the input OpenSeesPy model files.

lst.map: mainScript FileName(r) None Defines the name of the main model file which contains the build_model and run_analysis functions. True

map.str: Defines the number of degrees of freedom in the numerical model.

By default, the workflow assumes X=1, Y=2, Z=3 mapping between directions and degrees of freedom, with XY being the horizontal directions. This input allows you to define an alternative mapping by providing three numbers separated by commas in a string, such as '1, 3, 2' if you wish to have Y as the vertical direction.

lst.map: ctrlNodes string None Defines the IDs of nodes in the OpenSeesPy model where EDPs are recorded. If the number of ctrlNodes provided exceeds the number of stories, only the firsts n+1 nodes will be used for an n-story building. True

map.str: File containing model information for response simulation.

Creates SAM.json file containing model information for an input OpenSeesPy structural model. The functions 'build_model' and 'run_analysis' must be defined in the model script. Analysis is executed in the OpenSeesPySimulation application.

Returns the input event IM as the EDP in the absence of a response simulation method. This application is appropriate to use when damages and losses are estimated as function of IM in the DL assessment.

File containing a dictionary of building information.
File containing event intensity measure for each simulation per building.
File containing model information for response simulation.
File containing type, location, and direction of recorded EDPs from the response simulation.
File containing constants, settings, and methods for the response simulation. This file is deleted after the application is executed.
Batch file containing commands for Dakota to execute, located in the working directory for each simulation.
Defines the UQ sampling method to use.
Specifies the number of realizations to generate. For surrogate models, these samples are used to train the model.
Specifies the random seed for sampling.
Only for surrogate models. Specifies the number of realizations to generate from the trained model.
Only for surrogate models. Specifies the random seed to generate samples from the models.
Specifies the importance sampling method to use
Specifies the number of processes to use for simulation.
True if the intermediate results shall be kept (not deleted) for each sample.
Uses the uncertainty quantification package Dakota to sample random variables and execute the workflow driver file.

File containing the DL model information. The default is to source it from the building source file.
File containing type, location, and direction of recorded EDPs from the response simulation.
Defines the damage and loss assessment method. Available choices include 'FEMA P58', 'HAZUS MH EQ', 'HAZUS MH', 'HAZUS MH EQ IM', and 'HAZUS MH HU'.
Specifies the number of loss realizations to generate.
If False, only the main results are saved to improve efficiency.
If False, pelicun does not create a run log file.
If True, the raw EDPs are used as-is without resampling.
Defines the time of the event in YYYY-MM-DD:HH format. 'off' turns all time-effects off.
If True, fragility groups associated with ground failure are added in the auto-population phase. Note that such analysis requires PGD values as inputs.

Performs damage and loss (DL) assessment using the pelicun Python package. The application uses built-in fragility functions and the replacement cost defined in the building source file to determine damage state and loss likelihoods.
path to file containing location information on each event file
number of event samples to assign to each building
number of neighboring event sites to sample from

Assigns events to building site by sampling from nearest neighboring event sites, using coordinate locations. The user specifies the number of sampled events and the number of neighbors to sample events from.
